fullText: This new production of '1776' makes explicit what the original only hinted at: that the men who founded America were as flawed and conflicted as the nation they created.
dtliExcerpt: This new production of '1776' makes explicit what the original only hinted at: that the men who founded America were as flawed and conflicted as the nation they created.
bwwExcerpt: Underlining one's progressiveness a thousand times, as this '1776' does, will not actually convey it better; rather it turns characters into cutouts and distracts from the ideas it means to promote. The musical even shows us that. It's only when Adams stops yelling and starts plotting that he begins to turn the tide toward ratification. Just so, theater makers should have enough faith in the principles of equity and diversity to let them speak for themselves. Are they not, as someone once put it, self-evident?
